intro: Phyteuma linifolium, commonly known as the slender phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, giving it a distinctive appearance. It blooms in late summer, producing clusters of pale blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators.
